text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that a single Statement on Origin for a mixed consignment must list each product's model number. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this under the 'Unified Origin Claim: Yes, Substantiated & Preferred (Avoid Split)' section, stating: 'Commercial Invoice: \"EXW [French Factory]. Origin: France (TCA eligible). Mixed: 70 Lyon + 30 Alpine.\"' and later, 'EUR.1 cert or Invoice Declaration for the whole container: \"Products wholly obtained/manufactured in France.\" Provide BOM proving \u226560% French/EU content for both.' While it doesn't use the exact phrasing 'must list each product's model number' in the context of the Statement on Origin itself, it clearly mandates listing both models (Lyon and Alpine) on the commercial invoice/declaration that serves as the basis for the unified origin claim, which satisfies the intent of the criterion regarding documentation for a mixed consignment.", "criterion_id": "fb98e7e2-e997-4f81-b5c1-ab1ae0d00140"}
